thread.title: Trump on His Relationship with Obama: ‘I Don’t Know If He’ll Admit This, But He Likes Me’
thread.title_full: Trump on His Relationship with Obama: ‘I Don’t Know If He’ll Admit This, But He Likes Me’

author: Josh Feldman
title: Trump on His Relationship with Obama: ‘I Don’t Know If He’ll Admit This, But He Likes Me’
text:
Trump on His Relationship with Obama: ‘I Don’t Know If He’ll Admit This, But He Likes Me’ by Josh Feldman | 8:32   video 
Bill O’Reilly aired more of his interview with President Trump tonight, and he got the president talking about his relationship with his predecessor. 
Trump said that he gets the feeling Barack Obama has a positive opinion of him, saying, “I don’t know if he’ll admit this, but he likes me.” 
He acknowledged the two of them were “vicious” towards each other, but said on inauguration day when they headed out in the morning they talked about “the future of the country” and what Obama thinks America’s biggest problem is going forward. 
O’Reilly also asked him about how it felt tearing into Obama’s policies during the inauguration with the former president sitting mere feet from him. 
You can watch Trump’s answer in the video above, via Fox News.
